content.description: Sit start on the right side of the roof with one hand on the big undercling and your other hand on one of the positive holds. Traverse along the lip with your hands on the lip and feet on the on the attached ledge. The detached block that is leaning against the ledge is off.As mentioned by Jennifer Legaspi, be very careful around the flake at the pinnacle of the roof, it's big and is gonna come off soon. There are some very positive holds just above it.
content.location: Sit start on the far right side of the boulder with a big undercling and a postive hold about a foot right of the big pinch.

content.description: Climb out of a small cave with a crack and up over the bulge. The "intended" variation was with a fingerlock and paddle-hand in the crack to start and a foot jam to pull over the top. The ramp at the bottom is on, which opens plenty of variations to get this one done.
content.location: When looking at the main roof here, look for the very small cave (just a couple feet deep) left of the slab that the Black Cat Subway and White Dog Tram finish on.

content.description: Stand start, and squeeze into a technical crawl until you reach the base of overhung dihedral. At this point, stand up to reach the lip, then traverse to the easy, slab topout. The 1.5 foot wide ledge connected to the roof is on. The block below the roof disconnected from the ledge is off.This climb will likely be very tricky for taller climbers until the dihedral.This boulder is pretty silly but is a good way to warm up for the remaining climbs.
content.location: Start on the pinchable block on the far right, and make your way into the corner of the roof traversing left to the dihedral. Stand, then follow the lip around the arete to the slab.

content.description: This is a roof boulder near the trail. You should be able to see it from the trail.
